sen.j: 木俣神（きのまたのかみ、このまたのかみ）は日本神話の中で、大国主が因幡の八上比売に生ませた神。
sen.e: According to the Japanese mythology, Kinomata no kami (also read as Konomata no kami) was born between Okuninushi (Okuninushi (chief god of Izumo in southern Honshu Island, Japan, and the central character in the important cycle of myths set in that region) and Yakami hime of Inaba.

According to the Japanese mythology, Kinomata no kami (also read as Konomata no kami) was born between Okuninushi (Okuninushi (chief god of Izumo in southern Honshu Island, Japan, and the central character in the important cycle of myths set in that region) and Yakami hime of Inaba.

According to the Japanese mythology, Kinomata no kami (木俣神) (also read as Konomata no kami) was born between Okuninushi (chief god of Izumo in southern Honshu Island, Japan, and the central character in the important cycle of myths set in that region) and Yakami hime of Inaba.

sen.j: 八上比売は大穴牟遅神の最初の妻であった
sen.e: Yakami hime was the first wife of Onamuji no kami.
Yakami hime was the first wife of Onamuji no kami.
Yakami hime was the first wife of Onamuji no kami.

sen.j: ところが、スセリビメを正妻に迎えたため、これを恐れ、子を木の俣に刺し挟んで実家に帰ってしまった。
sen.e: When Onamuji no kami took Suseribime as his legal wife, however, Yakami hime was so afraid of Suseribime that she returned to her parental home leaving her baby being placed in a fork of a tree.
When Onamuji no kami took Suseribime as his legal wife, however, Yakami hime was so afraid of Suseribime that she returned to her parental home, leaving her baby at a fork in a tree.
When Onamuji no kami took Suseribime as his legal wife, however, Yakami hime was so afraid of Suseribime that she returned to her parental home, leaving her baby at a fork in a tree.

sen.j: そのため、その子を名づけて木俣神という。
sen.e: That is why the baby was named Kinomata no kami.
That is why the baby was named Kinomata no kami.
That is why the baby was named Kinomata no kami.

sen.j: またの名を御井神（みいのかみ）という。
sen.e: Another name of this kami is Mii no kami (御井神).
Another name for this kami is Mii no kami (御井神).
Another name for this kami is Mii no kami (御井神).

sen.j: 『古事記』では性別不詳であるが、祭神としている各神社の社伝では、大穴牟遅神の長男としている例が多い。
sen.e: Although the gender of this kami is not known according to the Kojiki (Records of Ancient Matters), many shrines describe this kami as an eldest son of Onamuji no kami in their biography.
Although the gender of this kami is not known according to the Kojiki (Records of Ancient Matters), many shrines describe this kami as an eldest son of Onamuji no kami in their biography.
Although the gender of this kami is not known according to the "Kojiki" (Records of Ancient Matters), many shrines describe this kami as an eldest son of Onamuji no kami in their biography.

sen.j: 一般的に木の神、水神、安産の神として崇敬されている。
sen.e: Kinomata no kami is generally worshipped as kami of tree, kami of water and kami of a safe birth.
Kinomata no kami is generally worshipped as kami of tree, kami of water and kami of a safe birth.
Kinomata no kami is generally worshipped as kami of tree, kami of water and kami of a safe birth.

tit.e: Main shrines where Kinomata no kami is enshrined
